intro: Rhododendron vilmorinianum, commonly known as the Vilmorin’s rhododendron, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It features broad, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and requires partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
